chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher C. Burns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(b).
  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact [Modifiers: Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid at 25% of prison wages and any balance not paid is condition of ES.
Obtain/maintain FTE/schooling or combination thereof as determined by Department.
No contact with B.E. or any of her family.

Defendant must comply with WI Sex Offender Registration Law.  

DNA sample.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 2:07pm
State appears by DDA T.Wetzsteon; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney John Bachman.

COURT notes receipt of motion filed pro se by defendant 1/27/16 - Atty Bachman notes discussion w/defendant and Atty Bachman is not pursuing the motion filed pro se.
COURT also notes that defendant has been advised by COURT on several occassions that he has filed pro se motions that he cannot both represent himself and by court appointed counsel - COURT takes no further action on the pro se motion filed 1/27/16 as Atty Bachman has stated motion is not being pursued.

COURT questions parties re: PSI changes - Attorney Bachman states corrections/changes as does State.

State notes victim's mother is present and has no statement today, but requests COURT read her comments from Page 3 of PSI.
Argument by State on sentencing recommendation.
Argument by Attorney Bachman on sentencing recommendation.
Defendant makes statement.
COURT makes findings.

COURT ORDERS:
Ct. 1>> 31 years and 3 months TOTAL: 25 years incarceration and 6 years 3 months ES
Ct. 2>> 24 years TOTAL: 12 years incarceration and 12 years ES
Ct. 3>> 15 years TOTAL: 10 years incarceration and 5 years ES
>>All sentences to run concurrent to each other.
>>Credit for 387 days of time served on each count.
>>Defendant is NOT eligible for either CIP or SAP.

CONDITIONS OF ES: No contact with victim B.E. or any of her family; Defendant must comply with WI Sex Offender Registration law; Obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof as determined by Dept; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC; DNA surcharge on Ct. 1, remitted on Cts. 2 and 3; DNA sample; Restitution of $1426 - to be paid at 25% of prison wages and any balance not paid is condition of ES.

Defendant remanded to MCSD for delivery to WI State Prison system.
COURT reminds counsel of confidentiality of PSI that they are retaining.

Clerk Cheree
State appears by ADA T.Wetzsteon; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney John Bachman; Bailiffs Teresa and Richard.
DAY 3 OF JURY TRIAL

8:43am -- JURY/COURT reconvene; COURT questions jurors as to communication/research regarding this case - all jurors respond in the negative.
Testimony continues of Det. Kindlarski - reminded by COURT that he remains under oath.
8:45am -- JURY recesses; Parties discuss issue of cross-exam question of witness; COURT reviews information from previous transcript - Argument by Atty Bachman and by State; COURT gives ruling.
9:15am -- JURY reconvenes; Testimony continues; 9:30am - JURY recesses for parties to argue objection; COURT makes rulings; 9:33am - JURY reconvenes and testimony continues.
9:42am -- JURY recesses for COURT to address questions that are submitted regarding witness; COURT makes rulings; 10:00am - JURY reconvenes and testimony continues.
A.A. sworn and testifies - identifies defendant; 10:17am -- JURY recesses; State requests break for determination re: witnesses and Attorney Bachman requests break for discussion with client - COURT grants.
10:38am -- COURT reconvenes; Discussion re: exhibits; 10:43am -- JURY reconvenes; Testimony of A.A. continues; 10:44am -- State rests; JURY recesses.
COURT questions defense if they have any witnesses -- Atty Bachman states no witnesses and defendant choses not to testify; COURT holds colliquy with defendant regarding decision not to testify -- COURT finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to testify.
10:52am -- JURY reconvenes - Defense rests; COURT advises jury that testimony is closed, and there will be a longer break for COURT/parties to complete work
10:54am - JURY recesses; COURT directs parties to meet in office for jury conference in 10 minutes; COURT recesses.
12:18pm -- COURT reconvenes and places information on record regarding jury instruction conference; 12:23pm - JURY reconvenes; Closing argument by State; 1:03pm - Closing argument by Attorney Bachman.
1:12pm - Rebuttal closing by State; 1:15pm -- COURT reads jury instructions to jury; Alternate juror struck and Bailiffs sworn; 1:42pm -- JURY retires to deliberate.
COURT directs that no exhibits will go to jury room, and if any exhibits requested, COURT will discuss on the record w/counsel before providing; 1:45pm - COURT recesses.
2:10pm -- COURT reconvenes with counsel and reads question Jury has asked in writing; COURT discusses questions, argument by counsel, and COURT makes rulings; Exhibits/note sent to jury; 2:24pm -- COURT recesses.
4:09pm -- COURT reconvenes with counsel and reads question Jury has asked in writing;COURT discusses question and response sent to jury; 4:12pm -- COURT recesses.
*** Clerk change -- Kassidi
5:57 PM- BOTR. 
5:57 PM- JURY RECONVENES.
5:58 PM- RETURN/READING OF THE VERDICT.
Ct. 1 (1st Deg Child Sexual Assault/Under 12/Repeater)>> GUILTY.
Ct. 2 (1st Deg Child Sexual Assault/Sexual Contact Under 13/Repeater)>> GUILTY.
Ct. 3 (Child Enticement/Sexual Contact/Repeater)>> GUILTY.
6:00 PM- COURT POLLS JURY. 
6:02 PM -JURY RETIRES.
State requests that COURT enter judgment on all counts and revoke defendant's bond.
Parties make statements regarding the case and the Repeater allogations. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ENTERS JUDGMENT OF GUILT ON ALL COUNTS AS A REPEATER. 
COURT REVOKES DEFENDANT'S BOND.

COURT ORDERS: PSI to be done in this case. Parties are to set a 2 hour Sentencing Date within 60 days with JA.

Adj: 6:08 pm

Clerk Cheree
State appears by ADA T.Wetzsteon; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney John Bachman; Bailiffs Teresa and Richard

DAY 2 OF JURY TRIAL
BOTR: 8:49am -- COURT reconvenes not in presence of jury; State addresses instruction 158 - Parties state agreement and COURT adopts.
8:53am - JURY reconvenes; COURT advises jurors that an alternate will be struck at the conclusion of closing arguments; COURT also questions jurors as to communication/research regarding this case - all jurors respond in the negative.
B.E. sworn and testifies - identifies defendant.
9:34am - JURY/COURT recess; 10:17am -- JURY/COURT recess reconvene.
Jennifer Plisch (Child Advocacy Center) sworn and testifies. COURT reads instruction to jury as requested by counsel; Exhibit 15A played.
J.B. sworn and testifies - identifies defendant.
11:55am - JURY recesses; COURT discusses jury instruction with counsel; 11:58am - COURT recesses.
1:09pm - COURT/JURY reconvene; Testimony continues.
J.P. sworn and testifies; 1:18pm - JURY recesses for COURT to discuss questions received by jurors; 1:27pm - JURY reconvenes and testimony continues.
Tina Stephanus (Registered Nurse) sworn and testifies; 1:48pm - JURY/COURT recess; 1:58pm - JURY/COURT reconvene and testimony continues.
Detective Jon Kindlarski (WPD) sworn and testifies - identifies defendant; 2:54pm - JURY/COURT recess; 3:08pm - COURT reconvenes; 3:11pm - JURY reconvenes and testimony continues; COURT reads instruction to jury as requested by counsel; Exhibit 20A played.
3:52pm - JURY Recesses at their request; 3:59pm - JURY reconvenes and testimony continues.
5:15pm -- JURY recesses for the day; COURT has discussion re: exhibits with counsel - 5:20pm

State appears by ADA T.Wetzsteon; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney John Bachman; Bailiffs Teresa M. and Richard W.
11:30 am --COURT speaks to jury panel; All members ORDERED to return back to jury room no later than 12:40pm; COURT also directs panel they are not to discuss case and do any investigation or involve themselves with this case.
11: 33am -- JURY panel excused to return as directed.
11:35am -- (outside presence of jury); Atty Bachman requests on behalf of defendant that this trial be closed and not open to public; COURT questions re: authority, and none given - COURT denies motion.
11:40am -- COURT Recesses for lunch; 1:15pm -- COURT/JURY reconvenes.

Juror seated #31 - R.S.S. excused for cause by COURT And replaced by juror seated #32 - T.A.G.
1:41pm - Voir dire by State; 2:21pm - Individual voir dire in chambers accessible to public.
Juror seated #17 M.J.H. excused for cause by COURT and replaced by juror seated #33 - J.W.R.; Attorney Bachman moves to strike juror J.B. and argument by State - COURT denies.
BOTR in courtroom: 2:28pm and voir dire by State continues; 3:01pm - JURY recesses; 3:14pm - COURT reconvenes; State is questioning regarding witness - COURT notes witness may leave
3:18pm - Voir dire by Atty Bachman. 
3:35pm - COURT thanks and excuses all jurors seated behind rail; COURT orders attorneys to strike list.
3:47pm - COURT reads list of jurors chosen to hear case and excuses those not chosen.
3:40pm - JURY sworn; COURT reads preliminary jury instructions.
4:00pm - Opening statement by State; 4:05pm - Opening statement by Attorney Bachman.
4:10pm -- COURT directs jurors they may not conduct any research or discuss case and that COURT will question them tomorrow morning if any juror has done so when they reconvene at 8:30am.
4:13pm - JURY recesses; COURT notes another matter at 8:15am tomorrow morning, so parties to be ready at 8:30am tomorrow morning.
COURT adjourns 4:15pm

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:15am
State appears by ADA T.Wetzsteon; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Atty John Bachman.
(Hearing before jury trial)

COURT advises counsel that a number of jurors summonsed in have not reported and number of jurors available for this trial is 31; COC is attempting to call jurors who did not appear, and COURT will wait for Br. 5 jury to be selected, and then obtain jurors not selected for that case.

COURT notes that there are six motions filed pro se by defendant on 9/28/15 - Atty Bachman states he is not proceeding on any of those motions; COURT makes rulings and since appointed counsel choses not to pursue motions, COURT denies each of those motions.

COURT reminds counsel not to argue objections in the presence of jury.
State files final offer and offer is rejected by defendant; COURT orders that document sealed and cannot be opened unless by order of COURT; Atty Bachman states defendant has rejected all offers.

COURT addresses note taking by jurors -- neither party objects; COURT Allows jury to take notes.
COURT addresses allowing jury to ask questions - State objects and Atty Bachman requests any questions from jury be in writing and reviewed before answering; COURT will afford jurors to submit written questions after each witness to be reviewed by COURT/parties.

Atty Bachman requests any individual voir dire, and sidebars be attended by defendant -- COURT Grants.

State notes record made of agreed upon redactions from both CAC interview of child and defendant's interview, and have been reduced to writing in email; State files both interview transcripts/emails as Exhibits 13 and 14 respectively; Atty Bachman states agreement but requests that exhibits not be given to jury during deliberation - State gives response and requests cautionary instruction to jury; Atty Bachman states agreement with instruction and agrees that transcripts are true and accurate, and proposes that only transcripts be available to jury for deliberation.

COURT addresses issue of juror R.W. - if struck on panel from Br. 5 will not be on this panel; Additional information discussed re: jury panel.
Adj: 9:38am
State's Requeted Jury Instructions - stj

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 4:20pm
State appears by ADAs T.Wetzsteon and L.Gramer; Defendant appears in person/in custody and by Atty John Bachman by phone.

COURT notes to defendant that Atty Bachman has filed Motion to Withdraw as Counsel and reads aloud for defendant.
COURT also notes to defendant that he has the right to speak to Attorney Bachman privately at any time during this hearing - COURT questions if defendant wishes to speak to him privately now and defendant declines at this time.

Atty Bachman makes additional statement regarding his Motion to Withdraw -- COURT questions defendant if he wishes to go to trial next week with Atty Bachman; Defendant states he does wish JT to go forward next week and Atty Bachman to represent him at that trial.
COURT questions Atty Bachman if he is prepared to try case - Atty Bachman states he is prepared to try case adequately and effectively.

COURT notes speedy trial requested, trial delayed previously for reasons other than intentional delay, and that defendant/Atty Bachman are prepared for trial next week.
COURT makes findings - COURT denies Motion to Withdraw and matter remains on calendar for trial.

COURT addresses clothing for trial - states stun belt may not be visible through clothing; Defendant states he has tshirt and hoodie, and will ask officer to fit him with stun belt and sweatshirt.
COURT directs parties to be ready to move forward at 8:30am on date of trial.

State notes discussions ongoing regarding redactions on interviews -- State will provide transcript to COURT and make record before trial starts.
Forensic interviews of children are still being redacted and parties believe that agreement will be reached on those transcripts; Atty Bachman states agreement.

Attorney Bachman notes Motion may be filed - COURT directs that it must be filed by Friday the 9th, and must be heard on Monday, the day before trial.
COURT notes 6 Motions received by defendant 9/28/15 -- State has not received them nor has Attorney Bachman; 

COURT questions re: defendant has clothing for trial - defendant has clothing at jail and will be used; Jailer Blaschka will look into appropriateness of clothing.

Case called: 9:12am

COURT addresses issue regarding defendant's request to go forward with JT scheduled for 7/7/15>>
COURT notes at the end of the last hearing, Atty Bachman was to continue discussing issue with defendant; Atty Bachman states he did meet w/defendant after last hearing and has received discovery and reviewed.
Atty Bachman states he is now available on the original trial date for 3 days next week 6/17/15 - State notes they have reserved subpoenas for the July dates and ADAs are not available for the trial dates next week; COURT finds that all attempts have been made to hold speedy trial as soon as possible, and trial scheduled for 7/7/15 will go forward as rescheduled.

COURT questions Attorney Bachman re: discovery received at last hearing - Attorney Bachman states he has reviewed and does not need additional time to develop case, and he no longer needs additional time to be prepared for JT on 7/7/15, with exception as stated in court on defendant's testimony.
COURT questions defendant regarding Attorney Bachman's statement -- Defendant states understanding of issue regarding his testimony at trial.
Defendant objects to trial being held on 7/7/15 and requests trial be held on original June date - COURT denies and refers to ruling made earlier in hearing.

COURT has reviewed motion - Attorney Bachman gives argument; COURT makes rulings and grants motion.

COURT questions parties re: intent to introduce videotaped statement of child -- Attorney Bachman has reviewed all videos in question and requests hearing; COURT will need to review videos and needs another MH on that issue and the request filed today by State for victim to testify by A/V means; Motion hearing will be needed for 45 minutes, JA to contact parties on Monday to schedule.
COURT to review videos (4 videos on 3 DVDs) provided by State.
